items.title: Japanese IT firm NTT Data invests $500m in India for AI expansion
items.summary:
- NTT Data to invest $500 million in India within 12 to 18 months.
- Focus on expanding data center operations and enhancing AI capabilities.
- Currently operates 16 data centers in India with 290 MW capacity, plans to add 210 MW in 2-3 years.
- Investment will support sovereign cloud solutions for the financial sector.
- Upgrading Bengaluru Innovation Centre for AI, digital twin technology, and quantum computing.
- Total investment in India since 2007 exceeds $3 billion.

items.title: Apple loses appeal in Germany, faces stricter market rules
items.summary:
- Apple lost an appeal against a German regulatory decision leading to stricter market controls.
- The ruling was issued by the Federal Court of Justice in Karlsruhe on Mar. 18.
- The court upheld a 2023 classification of Apple by the German cartel office as a company with significant cross-market influence, similar to Google and Meta.
- Apple's request to involve the European Court of Justice was denied, reinforcing German regulations on tech giants.
- The ruling increases scrutiny of Apple's App Store due to concerns regarding user data collection.

items.title: GoTo denies rumors of Grab acquisition talks in Indonesia
items.summary:
- GoTo Gojek announced on Mar. 19 it has not agreed to any acquisition talks with Grab.
- This follows a report suggesting Grab was progressing in acquisition plans, causing Grab's shares to rise by 5.4% during premarket on Mar. 18.
- GoTo's shares also increased by 5% on the same day, following reports of intermittent merger discussions between both firms.

items.title: US-based Web3 firm Halliday nets $20m series A
items.summary:
- Halliday, a San Francisco-based web3 workflow protocol developer, raised US$20 million in a series A funding round led by a16z crypto.
- Other participants included Avalanche Blizzard Fund, Credibly Neutral, Alt Layer, and angel investors.
- Total capital raised by Halliday since its founding in April 2022 is now US$26 million.
- The funds will be used to expand the 17-person team and develop Halliday's workflow protocol and payments application, Halliday Payments.
- CEO Griffin Dunaif emphasized the goal of helping developers build blockchain applications more efficiently and the integration of AI systems within decentralized networks.

items.title: Venturi Partners launches $225m second fund for consumer brands
items.summary:
- Venturi Partners has launched a $225 million second fund targeting consumer brands.
- The fund aims to invest in high-quality consumer brands across various sectors.
- This initiative marks a significant step for Venturi Partners in expanding their investment portfolio.

items.title: Indian beauty brand Pilgrim bags $23m
items.author: Anurag Kedia, Gagandeep Makker
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based beauty brand Pilgrim raises $23 million (200 crore rupee) in funding.
- The company is valued at 3,000 crore rupee (approximately $346 million).
- Investors include Narotam Sekhsaria Family Office, Vertex Ventures SEAI, and new investors like Vertex Growth Fund.
- Funds will be used for offline expansion, R&D enhancement, and maintaining profitability online.
- Pilgrim was founded in 2019, offers sulphate and paraben-free products, and sells via multiple channels.

items.title: Israeli auto firm signs licensing deal worth up to $770m
items.summary:
- Ree Automotive announced a preliminary licensing agreement potentially worth up to $770 million by 2030.
- The deal involves an undisclosed mobility solutions company and is expected to be finalized soon.
- Ree will license its platform for self-driving vehicles, with production starting in 2027 and software revenue expected in the second half of this year.
- The company aims to enhance margins and profitability through its focus on software-defined vehicles instead of traditional manufacturing.
- The agreement could increase Ree's order backlog from $150 million to nearly $1 billion.
- CEO Daniel Barel emphasized the scaling production benefits.

items.title: Indian VC firm Gruhas, Brigade Group to launch $35m fund
items.author: Nikhil Kamath
items.summary:
- Gruhas partners with Brigade Group to launch a new fund focused on proptech and sustainability.
- The Earth Fund is worth 300 crore rupees (US$34.6 million) and is created under Zoiros Projects Private Limited.
- It includes a 200 crore rupees (US$23 million) SEBI-registered fund and a 100 crore rupees (US$11.5 million) green-shoe option.
- The fund will support 10-15 startups in real estate tech, construction tech, clean tech, and climate tech, with investments of US$1-2 million.
- Funded startups will receive mentorship from Brigade Group, which has previously supported over 80 startups through its REAP accelerator.

items.title: Ex-Indian fintech unicorn execs start asset management venture
items.summary:
- Ex-Indian fintech unicorn executives have launched a new asset management venture.
- The venture aims to optimize investment strategies through advanced technology and finance expertise.
- It focuses on providing innovative financial solutions to clients in the ever-evolving market.

items.title: Philippine fintech firm Higala bags $2.8m
items.summary:
- Higala, a Philippine digital payment platform, raised a total of $2.8 million in seed funding.
- Funding led by Talino Venture Studios and 1982 Ventures, a Singapore-based fintech-focused venture firm.
- Higala aims to improve financial access by connecting various banks and electronic money issuers to its instant payment network, reducing transaction costs and enhancing payment accessibility.

items.title: Digital Realty Forms Joint Venture to Enter Indonesia's Market
items.summary:
- Digital Realty and Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia have established a 50-50 joint venture named Digital Realty Bersama.
- The new entity will integrate Bersama Digital Data Centres in Jakarta, which includes two data centers: CGK10 and CGK11.
- CGK11 has an initial IT load capacity of 5 MW with potential expansion to 32 MW.
- Digital Realty invested approximately US$100 million for its stake and will earn management fees.
- Key executives from BDDC will continue in their roles, with Krishna Worotikan appointed as CFO.
- The data centers will provide various connectivity options, including access to APJII, the largest internet exchange in Indonesia.

items.title: US court rules AI art can’t be copyrighted
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- A recent court ruling has determined that art created by artificial intelligence cannot be protected by copyright.
- The case involved a challenge to the copyright eligibility of AI-generated works.
- This decision could have significant implications for the future of copyright law and AI-generated creativity.

items.title: MediaTek shares rise following partnership with Google
items.summary:
- MediaTek Inc shares surged on Mar. 18, 2025, after news of a collaboration with Google on a next-generation AI chip.
- During early trading, shares rose by 5%, closing with a 3.51% increase, outperforming the market's 0.69% rise.
- The partnership focuses on developing Google's seventh-generation Tensor Processing Unit (TPU) AI chip, set to launch next year after the sixth-generation TPU released last year.

items.title: US strengthens chip controls, warns DeepSeek over misuse
items.author: Howard Lutnick
items.summary:
- US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick addresses chip control measures against China.
- Claims Chinese AI company DeepSeek misused US semiconductor chips.
- Warning issued about individuals redirecting American chips for personal gain.
- The administration plans to integrate export controls in trade pacts to protect US interests.
- DeepSeek's recent activities include denying R2 model launch rumors and offering large discounts during off-peak hours.

items.title: US food logistic firm GrubMarket raises $50m series G
items.author: Mike Xu
items.summary:
- GrubMarket raised $50 million in a series G funding round.
- The company is valued at over $3.5 billion.
- Key investors include Liberty Street Funds, 3Spoke Capital, and ROC Venture Group.
- Founded in 2014, GrubMarket operates in all 50 US states, Canada, and over 70 other countries.
- Employs over 12,000 people with revenues exceeding $2 billion in 2024.

items.title: Samsung faces AI chip challenges
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics is facing concerns about its ability to capitalize on the AI boom ahead of its annual general meeting on Mar. 18, 2025.
- The company is experiencing a decline in its competitive edge, particularly in semiconductors, trailing behind SK Hynix in high bandwidth memory chips needed for AI graphics processing.
- Internal communications indicate a focus on maintaining the status quo rather than driving innovation, raising worries about corporate stagnation.
- Recent developments include increasing R&D spending to a record high of $61 billion in 2024, amid tough competition from TSMC exploring a partnership with Intel.
- Several recent articles detail significant changes and events concerning Samsung's operations, including wage increases and recruitment efforts across its subsidiaries.

items.title: US-based cloud IT firm Nerdio nets $500m, valued at $1.2b
items.summary:
- Nerdio, a Chicago-based software firm, raised $500 million in an equity funding round.
- The funding round was led by General Atlantic, with participation from Lead Edge Capital and StepStone Group.
- This investment increases Nerdio's valuation to $1.2 billion, up from $300 million in December 2022.
- The funds will be used to simplify cloud management, expand globally, and hire more engineers and sales staff.
- Nerdio's platform serves over 5 million users in more than 50 countries and includes customers like Chevron and Penn State University.
- Aaron Goldman and Asher Hecht from General Atlantic will join Nerdio’s board.

items.title: Adobe launches AI tools to enhance website navigation
items.summary:
- Adobe has introduced new AI tools to improve website navigation and marketing strategies for businesses.
- These tools are part of Adobe’s B2B software suite, which contributed to a significant portion of the company’s $21.5 billion revenue last fiscal year.
- The AI tools allow brands to customize marketing messages based on users’ online behaviors, adapting content based on the entry source, like TikTok ads or search engine results.

items.title: Nvidia CEO reveals AI shift in real-world applications
items.summary:
- Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang discussed the company's evolving position in the AI industry on Mar. 18, 2025.
- Emphasized the shift from training AI models to deploying them in real-world applications.
- Highlighted increasing computational requirements for autonomous agents and the significant multiplication of these needs compared to the previous year.
- Nvidia's stock dropped 2.5% following his remarks, indicating investor concern.
- Recent developments include a $12B cloud deal with OpenAI and a record revenue of $130.5B for FY 2025 driven by AI growth.

items.title: White House taps Starlink for Wi-Fi upgrade
items.summary:
- The White House is using [Starlink](https://www.techinasia.com/news/white-house-taps-starlink-wifi-upgrade), a satellite internet service from SpaceX, to enhance its Wi-Fi connectivity.
- The decision was made due to inconsistent cell service and a crowded Wi-Fi network at the property.
- Service is being provided from a government data center located several miles from the White House, with Starlink reportedly donating its service.

items.title: Oracle explores plan to address TikTok US security concerns
items.summary:
- Oracle is proposing a plan to address national security concerns regarding TikTok's operations in the US.
- The proposal includes providing data security assurances and potentially acquiring a stake in a new American entity.
- TikTok's algorithm will remain under ByteDance's control, raising US compliance concerns despite easing Chinese approval.
- The plan requires approval from the Trump administration, ByteDance, and Chinese authorities.
- Oracle is currently working with TikTok on Project Texas to secure US user data and prevent Chinese government backdoor access.
- TikTok's US operations are valued at up to $50 billion, with notable bidders including Frank McCourt and Alexis Ohanian.
- Vice President JD Vance is leading efforts towards a potential agreement to balance national security and TikTok's US operations.

items.title: East Ventures-backed Fore Coffee files for IPO
items.summary:
- PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Tbk launched its IPO on **Mar. 19**.
- The offering period is from **Mar. 19 to Mar. 21**, with up to **US1.88 billion** new shares offered.
- Offering price ranges between **160 to 202 rupiah** (approx. **US$0.01**).
- The IPO could raise up to **379.76 billion rupiah** (approx. **US$22.98 million**).
- Effective date is **Mar. 25**; public offering from **Mar. 26 to Apr. 9**.
- Electronic distribution of shares is expected on **Apr. 10**; listing on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on **Apr. 11**.
- Underwriters: **PT Mandiri Sekuritas** and **PT Henan Putihrai Sekuritas**.

items.title: India clears Tata Sons’ additional stake buy in Tata Play
items.summary:
- The Competition Commission of India has approved Tata Sons' acquisition of an additional 10% stake in Tata Play from Baytree Investments (Mauritius) Pte Ltd.
- Tata Sons previously purchased a 10% stake for 835 crore rupee (approximately USD 96.41 million) in April 2024, increasing its total ownership to 70%.
- The remaining 30% of Tata Play is owned by Walt Disney, and the company offers direct-to-home and OTT services amidst fierce competition in India's OTT market led by Reliance’s JioHotstar.

items.title: Bukalapak grows 7% in Q4, driven by marketplace revenue
items.summary:
- Bukalapak reported a 7% growth in Q4 driven by its marketplace revenue.
- The company's strategies in enhancing user experience and partnerships contributed to the revenue increase.
- Continued focus on digital transformation and market expansion expected to bolster future growth.

items.title: Singapore gov’t taps Oracle for secure cloud upgrade
items.summary:
- Singapore’s Defence Science and Technology Agency (DSTA) signs contract with Oracle for an isolated cloud region for the Ministry of Defence and Singapore Armed Forces.
- Announced on Mar. 18, the infrastructure aims to enhance Command, Control, Communications, and Computers (C4) capabilities.
- The air-gapped cloud will support data management, computing, and AI applications, ensuring high security and scalability.
- Operated by MINDEF’s Digital and Intelligence Service, it will enable AI integration for military uses.
- DSTA chief Ng Chad-Son emphasizes the transformative role of cloud and AI technologies in operational efficiency.
- The Oracle Cloud Isolated Region is tailored for secure, mission-critical environments, different from Oracle’s public cloud.

items.title: US blockchain firm Crossmint raises $23.6m
items.summary:
- Crossmint, an enterprise blockchain company, raised US$23.6 million in a funding round led by Ribbit Capital.
- Investors included Franklin Templeton, Nyca, First Round, and Lightspeed Faction; funding announced on Mar. 18, 2025.
- Funds will be used to develop infrastructure for AI agents and blockchain tools for enterprise applications.
- Crossmint's platform aims to simplify the creation of web3 products, reducing the need for specialized blockchain engineers for tasks like digital wallet creation and tokenization.

items.title: These funds have not invested in Singapore in the past year
items.summary:
- The article discusses funds that have not invested in Singapore over the past year despite previously backing companies in the region.
- Possible reasons for the lack of investment include market prioritization changes or waiting for a better investment climate.
- Emphasizes the importance of timing when reaching out to investors.

items.title: Pine Labs to launch IPO in second half of 2025, CEO says
items.author: Amrish Rau
items.summary:
- Pine Labs plans to launch its IPO in the second half of 2025, confirmed by CEO Amrish Rau.
- The IPO size remains undisclosed but sources indicate a potential US$1 billion issue.
- The company is currently valued between US$6 billion and US$8 billion, up from US$5 billion in 2022.
- Pine Labs provides payment solutions to over 500,000 merchants across India, the Middle East, and Southeast Asia.
- The company is shifting its domicile from Singapore to India, approved by the National Company Law Tribunal in August 2024.
- For FY24, Pine Labs reported operating revenue of 1,317 crore rupees (US$152.06 million) but a net loss of 187 crore rupees (US$21.59 million).
- If successful, this IPO could become the largest for an Indian fintech since Paytm’s US$2.5 billion listing in 2021.

items.title: Edtech firm Physics Wallah files for $531m IPO in India
items.summary:
- Physics Wallah has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an IPO valued at approximately US$531.4 million (4,600 crore rupees).
- The filing was made through the confidential route as reported by Moneycontrol.
- A significant portion of the IPO is expected to be an offer for sale (OFS), but details on the selling investors are not disclosed.
keywords: Securities and Exchange Board of India

items.title: Huawei appoints new head of its AI division Noah’s Ark Lab
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Huawei has appointed Wang Yunhe as the new head of Noah’s Ark Lab.
- Wang replaces Yao Jun, with the announcement made on March 18.
- Wang specializes in deep learning, model compression, and computer vision.
- His appointment is part of Huawei's effort to strengthen AI amid US sanctions and competition in the AI sector.
- Recent industry shifts include ByteDance restructuring its AI department and hiring former Google Fellow Wu Yonghui.

items.title: India’s Billion Electric Mobility appoints new CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Billion Electric Mobility has appointed Sanjeev Kulkarni as the new CEO.
- Kulkarni previously served as the company’s COO and has over 30 years of experience in the automotive sector.
- He was CEO of Kalyani Powertrain Limited from April 2021 to September 2022.
- Billion Electric Mobility specializes in electric mobility solutions for trucks and buses and is based in Vadodara, Gujarat.

items.title: Upmesh’s profits dive even as live commerce thrives
items.summary:
- Upmesh provides software tools for businesses engaged in live selling, but reported a steep drop in profits in 2023.
- The company saw a 21.5% decline in revenue year-over-year, with profit before taxes shrank by 80% to US$81,000.
- This decline coincides with leadership instability, having three CEOs in just two months: Wong Zi Yang, Shawn Teow, and interim CEO Tan Kim Hock.

items.title: B2B sales platform Apollo.io expands hiring in India
items.summary:
- Apollo.io plans to increase hiring in India over the next 12 to 24 months.
- The company aims to grow its Indian workforce by 40-50%, focusing on engineering and operational roles.
- Currently, Apollo.io employs over 200 individuals in India as part of its 700-member global workforce.
- India is viewed as a key talent hub due to expertise in AI, cloud computing, and data security.

items.title: Alphabet acquires cybersecurity startup Wiz in $32b deal
items.summary:
- Alphabet acquires cybersecurity startup Wiz for $32 billion, marking its largest acquisition ever.
- The deal exceeds a previous $23 billion offer by Google, postponed due to antitrust concerns.
- No further details on the acquisition have been disclosed at this time.

items.title: Carro launches new cars, discounts for private-hire drivers
items.summary:
- Carro, a Singapore-based online car marketplace, announces new car offerings celebrating a decade in operation.
- Transitioning from used cars, Carro will now offer parallel-imported vehicles with financing and after-sales services.
- New packages include a premium option with a 10-year warranty and 10 servicing sessions, and a basic option with a five-year warranty and five servicing sessions.
- Private-hire drivers can access loans up to ten years with no down payment via Carro’s financing unit, Genie Financial Services.
- Launch promotions feature discounts up to S$4,000 on selected models like the Toyota Voxy and Honda Stepwagon.
- Future plans include expanding to electric vehicle options.

items.title: Motion Ventures launches $100m fund for maritime tech
items.summary:
- Motion Ventures has launched a US$100 million fund focused on maritime technology.
- The initiative is the largest of its kind in the industry, announced on Mar. 18.
- The fund aims to invest between US$250,000 and US$10 million in at least 25 companies in the next 18 to 24 months.
- Target areas include digitalization and decarbonization in the global maritime supply chain.
- Motion Ventures has already secured over half of its funding target for Fund II.
- The fund marks a shift in strategy to include asset-intensive hardware alongside software support.

items.title: Baidu denies data leak in VP’s daughter controversy
items.summary:
- Baidu has denied a data breach related to its VP's daughter sharing private information online.
- Xie Guangjun's 13-year-old daughter claimed to have obtained data from her father, igniting speculation about a potential internal leak.
- The company’s head of security confirmed no data leak occurred and that employees, including Xie, do not have direct access to user databases.
- Xie publicly apologized on WeChat, expressing regret and acknowledging poor guidance for his daughter during an online argument that exposed personal details.

items.title: Nio, CATL ink strategic deal on battery swapping
items.summary:
- Nio partners with CATL to develop a battery-swapping network for its vehicles, aiming for standardization in the industry.
- CATL to invest up to 2.5 billion yuan (around US$347 million) into Nio's energy business.
- The collaboration focuses on integrating technologies to boost efficiency and value in the electric vehicle sector.

items.title: Payday pioneers face profit problems
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia’s earned-wage access (EWA) sector faces profitability challenges despite recent traction.
- Kredivo's acquisition of GajiGesa for US$12 million marks the sector's first major exit.
- EWA firms encounter high onboarding and operational costs, complicating profit generation.
- The fundraising environment for EWA startups is tough, leading to increased interest in mergers and acquisitions.
- Companies are exploring diversified revenue streams, like lending products and integration with fintech ecosystems.
- Paymongo is considering raising new capital by 2026 to support growth and expansion into Southeast Asia.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Singapore’s startups
Xiaomi EV hits 200,000 deliveries, revised 2025 target to 350,000
items.author: Lei Jun
items.summary:
- Xiaomi Auto has achieved a cumulative delivery milestone of **200,000 units** in less than a year since its debut.
- The company has raised its **2025 annual delivery target** from 200,000 to **350,000 units** due to strong market demand.
- Xiaomi Auto is increasing production and developing key technologies in **fast charging** and **autonomous driving** to strengthen its competitive edge in the EV market.

items.title: Lightspeed leads $3.2m round for Indian fashion quick commerce
items.author: Akshay Gulati, Om Prakash Swami, Bipin Singh
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based startup Slikk Club has raised US$3.2 million in a seed funding round led by Lightspeed.
- Multiply Ventures and angel investors like Abhishek Goyal and Madhav Tandan participated in the funding.
- The funds will be used to expand by opening new dark stores and strengthening the leadership team, aiming to cover 80% of Bengaluru’s pincodes.
- Founded in 2024, Slikk Club delivers fashion items within 60 minutes and offers instant returns and refunds.
- The platform features over 80 brands and plans to add 100 more in the next three months.
- Slikk Club competes with Blinkit and Myntra in India’s fashion quick commerce sector, with the market projected to reach US$200 billion by 2030.

items.title: AI coding startup Cognition raises funding, valuation hits $4b
items.author: Scott Wu, Steven Hao, Walden Yan
items.summary:
- Cognition AI Inc. raises funding, increasing valuation to nearly US$4 billion.
- Funding round led by 8VC, with participation from Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, Elad Gil, and Conviction Partners.
- Valuation doubled from US$2 billion last year.
- Founded in 2023, launched generative AI tool Devin in 2024 for code generation and debugging.
- Rising investor interest in AI coding assistants amid competition from GitHub Copilot, Amazon’s CodeWhisperer, and others.

items.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange temporarily halted trading
items.summary:
- The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) halted trading on Mar. 18 after a 5.02% decline in the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) to 5,146.
- Suspension took effect at 11:19:31 Jakarta Automated Trading System (JATS) time.
- Trading resumed at 11:49:31 JATS time without changes to the regular schedule.
- The IDX uses trading halts to manage market imbalances and protect investors from extreme price volatility.
- The IHSG had shown weakness earlier, falling by 0.99% on Mar. 17 to 6,450.8.

items.title: US tech firm Tray.ai acquires Israeli AI startup in multi-million deal
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Tray.ai, a US technology company, acquired Israeli AI startup Vanti in a deal worth tens of millions of dollars through a share exchange.
- Vanti was founded in 2019 by Smadar David and Nir Osiroff, and develops AI agents for optimizing manufacturing and industrial processes.
- The company’s no-code AI platform is utilized by global enterprises like Seagate and Flex for building predictive models.
- Vanti has raised US$22 million from various investors, including Insight Partners and True Ventures.
- The acquisition will allow integration of Vanti’s AI technology into Tray.ai’s platform, aiming to enhance AI agent development for enterprise applications.
- Rich Waldron, CEO of Tray.ai, highlighted the importance of Vanti’s expertise in knowledge modeling and process optimization.

items.title: US Commerce agency bans DeepSeek on gov’t devices, sources say
items.summary:
- The US Department of Commerce bans employees from using DeepSeek on government devices.
- Internal instructions prohibit staff from downloading or using DeepSeek applications or websites on government equipment.
- Lawmakers express data security concerns, with legislation introduced to prevent DeepSeek access due to risks of sensitive information benefiting the Chinese Communist Party.
- Several states and 21 state attorneys general advocate for nationwide bans amid rising tensions in AI and Chinese influence.

items.title: World Network, Razer unveil tool to ensure fair gaming
items.summary:
[World Network and Razer have collaborated to develop a new tool aimed at promoting fair gaming practices.]
[The tool focuses on eliminating cheating and ensuring a level playing field for all gamers.] 
[The initiative represents a broader commitment to integrity in competitive gaming environments.]

items.title: Dubai neobroker Amana expands crypto offerings
items.summary:
- Dubai-based neobroker Amana expands cryptocurrency offerings to over 450 coins.
- The selection includes major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and XRP, along with gaming and meme coins such as Decentraland and Trump Coin.
- Amana also provides access to various financial assets including US stocks, foreign exchange, commodities, gold, ETFs, REITs, and MENA stocks.

items.title: Grab in due diligence stage amid GoTo merger talks
items.summary:
- Grab Holdings Ltd. has initiated due diligence on GoTo Group.
- The review includes GoTo's financial accounts, contracts, and operations.
- Ongoing discussions are considering potential deal structures and valuations.
- Talks are described as preliminary, with no finalized agreement expected so far.

items.title: Chinese EV maker Geely’s declaration aims to cut costs
items.author: Li Shufu
items.summary:
- Li Shufu, founder of Geely, announces cost-cutting measures due to challenges in the EV market.
- The Taizhou Declaration aims to consolidate operations and boost efficiency across Geely’s brands.
- Released in late 2024, it addresses financial issues from a market slowdown and rising tariffs.
- Geely's EV brands reported combined losses of US$2.2 billion in the first three quarters of 2024.
- Company aims to increase vehicle sales from 3.3 million in 2024 to 5 million by 2027.
